section: Siri Raag - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਤੋਹੀ ਮੋਹੀ ਮੋਹੀ ਤੋਹੀ ਅੰਤਰੁ ਕੈਸਾ ॥
section: Siri Raag - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You are me, and I am You-what is the difference between us?

transliteration.text: tōhī mōhī mōhī tōhī antar kaisā .

melody.description: The basis of this Raag is steeped in the traditions of mainstream Indian Classical music. Siri Raag is serious and thought provoking in its nature and creates an atmosphere where the listener is led to heed the advice given therein. The listener (the mind) is made aware of the truth of the message and with this ‘education’ is given the strength to face the future with both humility and the ‘gained’ knowledge.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

section: Siri Raag - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: We are like gold and the bracelet, or water and the waves. ||1||

melody.description: The basis of this Raag is steeped in the traditions of mainstream Indian Classical music. Siri Raag is serious and thought provoking in its nature and creates an atmosphere where the listener is led to heed the advice given therein. The listener (the mind) is made aware of the truth of the message and with this ‘education’ is given the strength to face the future with both humility and the ‘gained’ knowledge.

text: ਜਉ ਪੈ ਹਮ ਨ ਪਾਪ ਕਰੰਤਾ ਅਹੇ ਅਨੰਤਾ ॥
section: Siri Raag - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If I did not commit any sins, O Infinite Lord,

transliteration.text: jau pai ham n pāp karantā ahē anantā .

melody.description: The basis of this Raag is steeped in the traditions of mainstream Indian Classical music. Siri Raag is serious and thought provoking in its nature and creates an atmosphere where the listener is led to heed the advice given therein. The listener (the mind) is made aware of the truth of the message and with this ‘education’ is given the strength to face the future with both humility and the ‘gained’ knowledge.

text: ਪਤਿਤ ਪਾਵਨ ਨਾਮੁ ਕੈਸੇ ਹੁੰਤਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Siri Raag - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: how would You have acquired the name, 'Redeemer of sinners'? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: patit pāvan nām kaisē huntā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: The basis of this Raag is steeped in the traditions of mainstream Indian Classical music. Siri Raag is serious and thought provoking in its nature and creates an atmosphere where the listener is led to heed the advice given therein. The listener (the mind) is made aware of the truth of the message and with this ‘education’ is given the strength to face the future with both humility and the ‘gained’ knowledge.

section: Siri Raag - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You are my Master, the Inner-knower, Searcher of hearts.

melody.description: The basis of this Raag is steeped in the traditions of mainstream Indian Classical music. Siri Raag is serious and thought provoking in its nature and creates an atmosphere where the listener is led to heed the advice given therein. The listener (the mind) is made aware of the truth of the message and with this ‘education’ is given the strength to face the future with both humility and the ‘gained’ knowledge.

text: ਪ੍ਰਭ ਤੇ ਜਨੁ ਜਾਨੀਜੈ ਜਨ ਤੇ ਸੁਆਮੀ ॥੨॥
section: Siri Raag - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The servant is known by his God, and the Lord and Master is known by His servant. ||2||

transliteration.text: prabh tē jan jānījai jan tē suāmī .2.

melody.description: The basis of this Raag is steeped in the traditions of mainstream Indian Classical music. Siri Raag is serious and thought provoking in its nature and creates an atmosphere where the listener is led to heed the advice given therein. The listener (the mind) is made aware of the truth of the message and with this ‘education’ is given the strength to face the future with both humility and the ‘gained’ knowledge.

text: ਸਰੀਰੁ ਆਰਾਧੈ ਮੋ ਕਉ ਬੀਚਾਰੁ ਦੇਹੂ ॥
section: Siri Raag - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Grant me the wisdom to worship and adore You with my body.

transliteration.text: sarīr ārādhai mō kau bīchār dēhū .

melody.description: The basis of this Raag is steeped in the traditions of mainstream Indian Classical music. section: Siri Raag - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Ravi Daas, one who understands that the Lord is equally in all, is very rare. ||3||

melody.description: The basis of this Raag is steeped in the traditions of mainstream Indian Classical music.
